column5: Going to Wabaskang with 9 other guys-all of whom have been there before. They say I'll be wasting my time if I try to catch lake trout there in late July. I want to prove them wrong. Any advice-locations, lures etc anyone can give me will be greatly appreciated. Thanks and tight lines!!

[font color=green size=3][b] I beleive Mc Leod bay would be the deep water that trout would be likely to be in right now. While Wabaskang has some trout, they are not very plentiful. More are caught by accident in the winter and spring before they go deep than in the summer. Good luck! :)
try the portage into wine lake on the north end of wabaskang. it has plenty of trout. GL
Thanks for the help-I will try both suggestions.

Been going to Wabaskang since 1970 the first two weeks of Aug. never seen many Lakers come in that time of year. There is a deep spot in front of Jim & Julie's camp by the little island, Aerobus bay, and wine lake are the places I know of that have produced some Lakers. Deep, patient, jigging with flashers.
